      • BigMemoryNet

        public BigMemoryNet(boolean draw)
        Builds a network with default parameters
        Parameters:
        draw - set true if graphics are necessary (slow)

      • BigMemoryNet

        public BigMemoryNet(java.lang.String name,
                    boolean draw)
        Parameters:
        name - name for logging
        draw - set true if graphics are necessary (slow)

      • BigMemoryNet

        public BigMemoryNet(int nn,
                    int ni,
                    double wr,
                    double maxw,
                    double nr,
                    java.lang.String name,
                    boolean draw)
        Parameters:
        nn - total number of neurons
        ni - number of inhibitory neurons
        wr - weights range
        maxw - max weight
        nr - noise range
        name - use if running parallel experiments; set to "" if no name necessary
        draw - set true if graphics are necessary (slow)

      • STP

        double STP(int i,
           int j)
        Short Term Plasticity according to Izhikevich PNAS (not Zenke nature). Should act on EE, EI Ref: large-scale_model_of_human_brain.pdf
        Parameters:
        i - presynaptic index
        j - postsynaptic index
        c_type - type of connection (values from CONSTANTS.java file).
        Returns:
        stp factor

      • STDP

        private double[] STDP(int i,
                      int j,
                      double dij,
                      double dji)
        Doublet Spike Timing Dependent Plasticity
        Parameters:
        i - presynaptic neuron index
        j - postsynaptic neuron index
        r_w -
        return - weight change array [dij, dji]

      • HSP

        public double HSP(double w,
                  double ref_w,
                  double z_m,
                  double si)
        HeteroSynaptic Plasticity
        Parameters:
        w - the weight before plasticity
        ref_w - the reference weight w_{ij}
        z_m - z^{minus}_{i}
        si - S_i
        Returns:
        the weight modification dw/dt
